com.flyingspaniel.nava.callback

Class AbstractCallback<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flyingspaniel.nava.callback.AbstractCallback<IN,OUT>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Callback<IN,OUT>, Emit.IListener<IN>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCallback.Canned, AbstractCallback.NOP

    public abstract class AbstractCallback<IN,OUT>
extends Object
implements Callback<IN,OUT>, Emit.IListener<IN>
    Abstract implementation of a Callback, which also implements Emit.IListener.
    Subclasses need only implement callback().

    Also contains a few special inner class implementations useful for unit tests

    Since:
    Copyright (c) 2013 by Morgan Conrad
    Author:
    Morgan Conrad
    See Also:
    This software is released under the MIT License

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractCallback.Canned<IN,OUT>
      Inner class mainly for tests, allows for canned results
      static class  AbstractCallback.NOP<IN>
      Class that does nothing (just calls failFast), then returns input unchanged

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.flyingspaniel.nava.callback.Callback

      protected void failSlow(Exception ex, IN in, Object... more)
      Fail Slow means that you will pass the Exception down to (perhaps the end) of the chain This is handy if you have special Exception handling and can tack it on the end of all the callbacks.

           IN in,
           Object... more)
                      throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: Callback
        The callback method
        Specified by:
        callback in interface Callback<IN,OUT>
        Parameters:
        ex - null, or an Exception thrown from an earlier callback. You should test for this!
        in - input data, probably coming from a previous callback
        more - additional input data (rarely used)
        Returns:
        result of processing
        Throws:
        Exception

                   IN in,
                   Object... more)
                        throws Exception
        Override this if you want to do something to try to recover
        Parameters:
        ex - the Exception that was thrown by a previous callback
        in - results from the previous callback, usually null and ignored

      • failFast

        protected void failFast(Exception ex,
            IN in,
            Object... more)
                 throws Exception
        Fail Fast means that you want this completedCallback to handle the exception
        Parameters:
        ex - if null, nothing happens
        in - results from the previous callback
        Throws:

      • failSlow

        protected void failSlow(Exception ex,
            IN in,
            Object... more)
                 throws Exception
        Fail Slow means that you will pass the Exception down to (perhaps the end) of the chain This is handy if you have special Exception handling and can tack it on the end of all the callbacks.
        Parameters:
        ex - if null, nothing happems
        in - results from the previous callback
        Throws:
        Exception
